programme.title: Broken Arrow
programme.desc: A lone frontiersman (James Stewart) risks his life to forge peace between Arizona settlers and Cochise's (Jeff Chandler) Apache nation.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Longley rides to the rescue when four gunmen ambush a man riding in a buggy; Longley brings the wounded man to a nearby house, but nobody wants to help him because he's a judge scheduled to preside over the trial of a local land baron.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Longley, trapped by a landslide, is rescued by a man on the run from the law; he's accused of shooting a man, but the sheriff just assumed he's guilty because he's already served a jail term -- and he's sweet on the sheriff's sister.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Longley and Acosta travel to San Thomas to bid on a shipment of rifles and ammunition; they're outbid by a beautiful blonde woman working for a notorious gun runner; Longley and Acosta must now prevent the gunrunner's plans to arm the Apaches.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Longley stumbles across a cabin and its dead owner; the dead man's brothers believe Longley to be the killer and are preparing to string him up when he's rescued by a stranger.

programme.title: The Cheyenne Social Club
programme.desc: Two cowboys (James Stewart, Henry Fonda) ride from Texas to Wyoming to claim an inheritance which turns out to be a brothel.

programme.title: The Gambler Wore a Gun
programme.desc: The new owner (Jim Davis) of a ranch has a problem with the deed, caused by a noose.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: After someone shoots at Hoppy and Red in a seemingly deserted town, they discover that the town's only resident has been shot and left for dead.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy and Red resolve to help local ranchers against an exploiter who wants to take over Stone Valley and sell it to the cavalry.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Drought threatens cattlemen and the banker extending their credit.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: A banker asks Hoppy to trap robbers hijacking gold shipments.

programme.title: Guns of the Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: A mercenary (George Kennedy) recruits a knife man (James Whitmore), a gunman (Monte Markham) and four outlaws to free a Mexican patriot from prison.

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven Ride!
programme.desc: A marshal (Lee Van Cleef), an Eastern reporter and five ex-convicts rescue widows from Mexican bandits.

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven
programme.desc: A man in black (Yul Brynner) recruits six hired guns to lead Mexican villagers against the gang of an outlaw (Eli Wallach).

programme.title: Return of the Seven
programme.desc: The man in black (Yul Brynner) forms a new Magnificent Seven, to save Mexican farmers from slave labor.

programme.title: Lonesome Dove
programme.desc: Two former Texas Rangers renew their spirit of adventure as they and other residents of a Texas town join a cattle drive to the Montana Territory.

programme.title: Lonesome Dove
programme.desc: Call (Tommy Lee Jones) and Gus (Robert Duvall) are forced into a confrontation with an old enemy who kidnaps and brutalizes Lorena.

programme.title: Lonesome Dove
programme.desc: Jake's (Robert Urich) involvement with the Suggs gang reaches a tragic climax; Gus reunites with an old flame (Anjelica Houston).
